subject: Personal Finance
title: Medical Debt in America
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Medical Debt in America.

hook.text: Two-thirds of US bankruptcies are linked to medical bills. Getting sick can be financially fatal.

buildup.text: The US is the only wealthy nation where medical debt is a leading cause of financial ruin.

discovery.text: Unlike other debts, medical debt is involuntary. Nobody chooses to have a heart attack.

twist.text: Hospital prices vary wildly. The same procedure can cost $3,000 or $30,000 depending on the hospital.

climax.text: Medical debt affects credit scores, job prospects, and housing applications â€” a cascade of consequences.

punchline.text: In America, illness is a financial event.

quiz.question: What fraction of US bankruptcies are linked to medical bills?
